ygData.messageBody:
>From: Nick Emmerich <seorin@...>
>
>I think the best solution for enchanted armor is to allow metal >sheets to
>be made of precious metals. Then enchanters would already >have the spells
>implemented. We'd be able to make enchanted silver >banded, enchanted
>electrum banded, enchanted gold banded, and >enchanted platinum banded :)
>That'd be neat, and it's the easiest to >implement...
>-Rennin of E'Ci
> Trade Council GM
>

I thought about that as well. Guess it's a matter of implementing it though.
I also like the idea of a tag to show who made the item. Not sure if it's
feasible or not.

I'd also like to see being able to use other ores/metals as well, (like
steel, admanatium, bronze etc.) and to be able to smith weapons (using these
ores as well). Perhaps quests could lead to the discovery of these
metals/ore locations?
